Figure 19 shows the revenue-cost structure facing the monopolist. Note that production
will expand until MR = MC at optimal output Q*. To find the price at which it will sell
Q* units, you must go to the demand curve. The demand curve itself does not determine
the optimal behavior of the monopolist. Just like the perfect competition model, the
profit maximizing output for a monopolist is where MR = MC. To ensure a profit, the
demand curve must lie above the firm's average total cost (ATC) curve at the optimal
quantity so that price > ATC. The optimal quantity will be in the elastic range of the
demand curve.
